title: Grow More Give More: Planting a Raised Bed Garden

tasks.task: Setting up a raised bed garden
subtasks: Determining the appropriate planting design for the raised bed
Understanding spacing requirements for different vegetables in a raised bed
Applying block planting techniques for maximum space utilization
Adjusting planting distances based on vegetable size (e.g., 24 inches for large crops, 1 foot for medium, four to six inches for smaller)
Using dense planting methods for higher yield per square foot

tasks.task: Contacting local county extension office for further assistance
subtasks: Reaching out to extension office for more information on raised bed gardening
Visiting the provided website (aces.edu) for additional resources
